newsitem.title: ISRAEL: Main events leading up to Hebron handover.
newsitem.headline: Main events leading up to Hebron handover.

text.p: Here is a chronology of key Israeli-Palestinian events leading up to the Hebron handover:
Sept 13, 1993 - Israel and PLO, after months of secret talks in Oslo, sign declaration outlining plans for Palestinian self-rule in the occupied territories.
Feb 25, 1994 - Jewish settler Baruch Goldstein sprays gunfire on kneeling Arab worshippers in a mosque in Hebron in the West Bank, killing 29 before survivors beat him to death.
May 4, 1994 - Israel and PLO sign accord giving Palestinians in Gaza and Jericho their first taste of self-rule since 1967 Middle East war.
May 11 - Israel begins transfer of power to PLO, hands over Gaza Strip military base to Palestinian police officers.
May 13 - Israel hands over Jericho in West Bank to jubilant Palestinian police. Townspeople awaken to find Palestinians with AK-47 rifles standing guard on roof of police station.
July 1 - PLO leader Yasser Arafat returns to self-ruled Gaza after more than a quarter century of Israeli occupation, takes over as head of the Palestinian Authority.

Sept 28, 1995 - Israel and PLO agree to extend self-rule to much of West Bank after months of tense negotiations. Accord, nearly 16 months behind schedule, calls for Israeli troops to begin leaving West Bank Arab population areas 10 days later.
Nov 4 - Israeli Prime Minister Yitzhak Rabin, who signed the deals with Arafat, assassinated by religious Jew opposed to Oslo peace deal.
Nov 13 - Israel, led by Shimon Peres, begins redeployment from seven West Bank towns, handing over Jenin to PLO.
Dec 10 - Israel hands over Tulkarm, the second town.
Dec 11 - Israel hands over Nablus ahead of schedule.
Dec 16 - Israel hands over Qalqilya, closest town to its border with West Bank.
Dec 21 - Israel hands over Bethlehem, the birthplace of Jesus, just before Christmas.
Dec 27 - Israel hands over Ramallah, the sixth town.
March 23, 1996 - Israel, rocked by Islamic militant suicide bombings that kill 59 people, puts off scheduled withdrawal from Hebron, the seventh town.
May 29 - Right-wing Israeli leader Benjamin Netanyahu ousts Peres in national elections vowing to boost Israeli security.
Sept 25 - Violence erupts, claiming lives of 60 Arabs and 15 Israeli soldiers in West Bank and Gaza.
Oct 6 - Following White House emergency summit, Israel and PLO launch weeks of marathon talks on Hebron redeployment.
Jan 1, 1997 - Off-duty Israeli soldier Noam Friedman fires his M-16 rifle into Arab market in Hebron, wounding seven Palestinians in what he says is a bid to sabotage handover.
Jan 15 - Deal signed clearing way for redeployment.
